data.title: Always tasty
data.text: Every now and then I get a craving for authentic Spanish cooking. I always go to La Cazuela. The food is always fresh, well prepared and tasty. I especially like the pork. The empanadas are amazing. Even if you just get rice and beans, you will be very pleased. Not the best section of town, but don't let that scare you away from a really good lunch.

data.title: Amazing Taste
data.text: I went to la Cazuela on Easter and they were open, I was so happy since I was looking for some hispanic/latino food. The food was incredibly delicious, I ordered the Churrazco and the meat was tender and full of flavor. My daughter who is 6 and VERY picky ordered the 1/2 chicken and she eat the WHOLE thing. My son ordered the cheeseburger because he wanted to be "safe" and he loved it and on top of that he eat part of my meal too and my side orders (fried yellow plantains, rice and beans). My mother in law ordered the breaded shrimp and this is the frist time I ever see her eating a whole meal. I am definitely impressed and will come back here very soon.... I hear someone said their chicken is the BEST in Connecticut....and I believe it!

data.title: Cheap food and lots of it.
data.text:
Downtown Waterbury is a tough neighborhood.  From the outside, this restaurant looks nice.  Inside it's a cafeteria-style line with lots of seating.  The lunchtime special is just $4.99 for a ton of rice and stewed meats.  Plantains etc are extra.

The food is very tasty and the crowds are plentiful.

data.title: Muy mala experiencia
data.text: Servicio muy malo y el baño super sucio.. Las personas que atienden ahi son muy agresivas y mal servicio al Cliente.....

data.title: Comiendo
data.text: Muy rica comida pero mal organizados un poquito viejito todo adentro las muchachas muy amable .....................
